title: A term object.
description: An individual term. Terms are generally used for categorising and grouping posts.

version.description: The schema version that this term object adheres to.

id.description: The term ID. It must be a positive integer.

taxonomy.description: The type of term this is. WordPress defines two default taxonomies: 'tag', and 'category'. Any other taxonomy would need to be defined by a plugin.

slug.description: The URL slug that refers to this term.

parent.description: The ID of the parent term for this term, or 0 if it doesn't have a parent.

name.description: The display name of this term.

description.description: The long-form description of the this term. It can be stored as a string (eg, of HTML), or as an array of block objects.
